definition: the act of bearing the weight of or strengthening, establish or strengthen as with new evidence or facts
details:
noun
- the act of bearing the weight of or strengthening
= example: the act of bearing the weight of or strengthening
= synonyms: supporting
- aiding the cause or policy or interests of
= example: aiding the cause or policy or interests of
- the activity of providing for or maintaining by supplying with money or necessities
= example: the activity of providing for or maintaining by supplying with money or necessities
- any device that bears the weight of another thing
= example: any device that bears the weight of another thing
- supporting structure that holds up or provides a foundation
= example: supporting structure that holds up or provides a foundation
- something providing immaterial assistance to a person or cause or interest
= example: something providing immaterial assistance to a person or cause or interest
- a musical part (vocal or instrumental) that supports or provides background for other musical parts
= synonyms: accompaniment, backup, musical accompaniment
- the financial means whereby one lives
= synonyms: living, sustenance, keep, livelihood, bread and butter
- financial resources provided to make some project possible
= example: financial resources provided to make some project possible
= synonyms: funding, backing, financial support, financial backing
- documentary validation
= synonyms: documentation
- a military operation (often involving new supplies of men and materiel) to strengthen a military force or aid in the performance of its mission
= example: a military operation (often involving new supplies of men and materiel) to strengthen a military force or aid in the performance of its mission
= synonyms: reinforcement, reenforcement
verb
- establish or strengthen as with new evidence or facts
= synonyms: sustain, substantiate, confirm, affirm
- put up with something or somebody unpleasant
= synonyms: stand, bear, stomach, digest, brook, suffer, put up, endure, stick out, tolerate, abide
- adopt as a belief
= synonyms: subscribe
- argue or speak in defense of
= example: argue or speak in defense of
= synonyms: defend, fend for
- be a regular customer or client of
= synonyms: patronage, patronize, patronise, keep going
- be the physical support of
= synonyms: hold, sustain, hold up
- to play a subordinate role or assist
= example: to play a subordinate role or assist
- provide aid to materially or financially
= example: provide aid to materially or financially
- be behind
= synonyms: back, endorse, indorse, plump for, plunk for
- give moral or psychological support, aid, or courage to
= example: give moral or psychological support, aid, or courage to
= synonyms: back up
- support with evidence or authority or make more certain or confirm
= synonyms: corroborate, underpin, bear out
